cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 165 mi SE of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across Cuba today, then north-northwest over the eastern Gulf and turning northeast across north Florida into coastal Georgia and the Carolinas late Wednesday–Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west-coast Big Bend area (near Cedar Key)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Current warnings confined to the Florida Keys and the west coast of Florida (Flamingo to Englewood)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West coast of Florida, then coastal Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: 20–35 kt winds possible late Wednesday night into Thursday with a 22% chance of reaching tropical-storm force
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (<3 ft) possible around high tide, but significant surge not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with local pockets near 6 inches could cause flash and urban flooding in the Savannah area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous rip currents possible as the system passes
